column4: is there a way to run apple applications on ubuntu? like itunes?
why is there no appliction like wine for mac?
why would you need wine for mac? what is it you need to run on a mac that might require wine?
i mean an application the emulates mac instead of windows

nope.. but mac is based in unix with apple's personal tweeks.. their system is very similar to linux.. so if you're a programmer or tinker-er, you might be able to port programs over, develop something that will allow them to run like wine or simply use a different program that is designed for linux.  That's why I've stayed away from ipod's/touches etc.. to  locked it.
not sure if it's available for the touch but rockbox is available for ipods.. I understand it's a good alternative to apples interface and opens the ipod up so even ogg files will play
i need it on my laptop
virtual box and an install of windows will allow you to install itunes
i dont want to start a virtual pc just to listen to music
naw.. just to sync  there are tools to rip the music out of the ipod database in linux and play it. drm is an issue
